abstract: More than one dozen youth programs across New York City face uncertain future after failing to pass new grant-award process at the New York Office of Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Services; new system has been widely criticized as cumbersome and confusing, and could force closures of long-established programs like the Mount Sinai Adolescent Health Center.
lead_paragraph: The state agency that denied grant awards said that some groups’ applications were insufficient, but representatives of the nonprofits said the new bidding process was unfair.

headline.main: Youth Programs Imperiled After New York Changes How Grants Are Awarded
headline.print_headline: Youth Programs Imperiled After the State Changes How Grants Are Awarded

snippet: The state agency that denied grant awards said that some groups’ applications were insufficient, but representatives of the nonprofits said the new bidding process was unfair.

keywords.value: Office of Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Service (NYS)
keywords.name: organizations
